comments.content:
Detailed Report: https://oss-fuzz.com/testcase?key=4869045167915008

Project: tarantool
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer
Fuzz Target: luaL_loadbuffer_fuzzer
Job Type: libfuzzer_asan_tarantool
Platform Id: linux

Crash Type: Stack-use-after-return WRITE 8
Crash Address: 0x7b493e13a368
Crash State:
  lj_mem_newgco
  lj_tab_new
  lj_BC_TNEW
  
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)

Recommended Security Severity: High

Regressed: https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_tarantool&range=202402011200:202402011801

Reproducer Testcase: https://oss-fuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4869045167915008

Issue filed automatically.

See https://google.github.io/oss-fuzz/advanced-topics/reproducing for instructions to reproduce this bug locally.
When you fix this bug, please
  * mention the fix revision(s).
  * state whether the bug was a short-lived regression or an old bug in any stable releases.
  * add any other useful information.
This information can help downstream consumers.

If you need to contact the OSS-Fuzz team with a question, concern, or any other feedback, please file an issue at https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues. Comments on individual Monorail issues are not monitored.

This bug is subject to a 90 day disclosure deadline. If 90 days elapse
without an upstream patch, then the bug report will automatically
become visible to the public.

> HINT: this may be a false positive if your program uses some custom stack unwind mechanism, swapcontext or vfork (longjmp and C++ exceptions *are* supported)

By default, CMake option ENABLE_BUNDLED_LIBUNWIND is enabled in Tarantool, and we don't touch it on building fuzzing tests.

Probably a duplicate of https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=66725.
Not reproduced with the fix mentioned in https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT/issues/1169.

ClusterFuzz testcase 4869045167915008 is verified as fixed in https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_tarantool&range=202404111200:202404111800

If this is incorrect, please file a bug on https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues/new

This bug has been fixed. It has been opened to the public.

- Your friendly Sheriffbot
